info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 9:37AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES UNTIL 11 AM... WEATHER... * Light to moderate snow continues to impact the northern portions of Southeast Michigan through the late morning hours. * Snow accumulations of 1-2 inches possible before temperatures warm above freezing this afternoon. * Air temperatures will range between 32 and 34 degrees this morning. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow has led to slippery roads as MDOT traffic cameras indicate sections of I-75 have become snow covered again. * Snowfall will cause additional reductions of visibility to less than one mile at times. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
